title: What is the difference between an author and a writer? - THE KNOWLEDGE PLUG - Quora

response.answer_text: Writer and author both concerned to writing. However an author us supposed to be the creator or originator of any written work such as a book or play, and is also considered a writer. More broadly defined, an author is "the person who originated or gives existence to anything" and whose authorship determines responsibility for what was created. The word writer suggests a person engaged in writing books, articles, stories, etc., especially as an occupation or profession; an author or journalist. a clerk, scribe, or the like. a person who commits his or her thoughts, ideas, etc., to writing: an expert letter writer.
The age-old “all, but not all reply”-All authors are writers, but not all writers are authors.
